alt: A screenshot of the webpage, showing 2 examples of how quirks mode and standards mode render differently.
title: Quirks mode vs Standards mode
description: In the event that you're still interested in quirks mode, here is a demo page that illustrates some of the differences between quirks mode and standards mode rendering in browsers.

alt: An abstract graphical artwork, rendered by the demo.
title: Styles in HTML
description: Who says we need CSS at all? The default user-agent styles of HTML elements comes with variations in sizes and colors already. More than enough to get some cool stuff done! (Kidding obviously, this was done while waiting for my flight at the airport, just trying to kill time really.)

alt: PerformancePaintTiming
title: Paint performance API test page
description: A test page for the PerformancePaintTiming API.

alt: Masonry is awesome
title: CSS Masonry resources
description: A list of all the resources you will need to learn more about the CSS Masonry proposal, to try it out in your own projects, and provide feedback.

alt: An abstract artwork, rendered by the demo.
title: Friday abstract CSS animation
description: WARNING: this page has lot's of rapidly moving parts. Animations are turned of if you've configured your system for reduced motion though. This is fun CSS animation, for no reasons other than today is Friday.

alt: A grid layout illustration with blue column decorations and red row decorations.
title: CSS gap decoration resources
description: A list of all the resources you will need to learn more about the CSS gap decoration proposal, to try it out in your own projects, and provide feedback.

alt: A blue square inside a gray square
title: CSS alignment in block layouts
description: Testing the align-* and justify-* CSS properties in a block layout. View the source code of that page to learn more.

alt: Screenshot of the cheatsheet.
title: Navigating the web platform
description: A cheatsheet of sorts, to help you navigate the intricacies of the web platform. How to keep track of what's new? How to influence what's coming next?

title: execCommand sample
description: A sample page for the execCommand() method.

title: Local Fonts API
description: A sample page for the Local Fonts API.

alt: Screenshot of the frameset demo page
title: Framesets!
description: Got nostalgic and wanted to see if the <frameset> element still worked in browsers. And it does! At least for now, I'll have to check this page every once in a while to see if browsers end up removing their implementation of the element. If you don't know about this element, it's a way to include multiple frames in a webpage, in columns and rows, like a grid, where each frame is an embedded webpage. This made it possible to load content in parts of a webpage, without reload the entire page, which was useful before the Ajax era.

alt: A notification that says Hello World
title: Notifications API's support for icon and tag
description: Testing support for the icon and tag properties of the Notifications API across browsers.

alt: Lego toys
title: CSS object-view-box property sample page
description: Testing the object-view-box CSS property across browsers.

alt: Screenshot of the page
title: BCD impl_url data visualization
description: The browser-compat-data project contains some links to browser bugs for features that aren't implemented. This webpage displays this data: a list of unimplemented web features, along with the browser where they're missing, and a link to the browser's bug tracking system about the feature.

alt: A few examples of W3C badges
title: W3C badges custom element demo
description: Having fun with web components with this simple custom element that can be used to render old-school-looking W3C badges at the bottom of web pages.

alt: A screenshot of the page
title: CSS color-mix demo
description: A page that illustrates the use of the CSS color-mix() function.

alt: A screenshot of the page
title: CSS background-image painter
description: An experiment to see how far we can go with drawing inside a single div element by using multiple background gradient image components. Just click and hold to start drawing. The page becomes really slow really quickly, but the element seems to have no problem with thousands of gradients.

alt: A screenshot of the page
title: Looper
description: A multi-track audio looper that uses the Web Audio API to let you create ephemeral soundscapes and short songs.

alt: A screenshot of the page
title: Puzzle
description: A simple puzzle game, which I made with CSS grid and CSS masking. I made it to learn about CSS masking and SVG.

alt: A screenshot of the page
title: Browser versions
description: The list of browser (and server runtime) versions, according to BCD.

alt: Example of a kaleidoscope
title: Kaleidoscope
description: A fun CSS demo of a kaleidoscope image, rendered in CSS, which uses tan(), clip-path, and a few other cool CSS techniques. Drag an image onto the page to generate other images, and use the controls in the top-right corner to change the rendering.

alt: The playlists page
title: Mix Tapes
description: A little demo showing my recent Spotify playlists just for me to learn new CSS tricks. Caution: not tested across browsers. Likely to break for you.

alt: An illustration showing red boxes
title: debug.css - The simple CSS debugging utility
description: Type outline:1px solid red much? I'm sure you do. This little utility makes it easier to debug your CSS rules, by just adding `debug` to any selector.

alt: Picture of the eye that this demo webpage draws using gradients
title: CSS eye
description: A simple pair of eyes, using CSS, just to teach myself how to use the radial-gradient CSS function.

alt: The What's That Tool? game logo
title: What's That Tool?
description: A game where you try to name as many DevTools panels as you can in 60 seconds! Even if you've been a web developer for a long time, you might be surprised by how few tools you know.

alt: The Open-UI logo
title: Selectmenu tests
description: A few real use cases that normally require a custom select component, made with the beta selectmenu component available in Chromium.

alt: thumbnail of the EyeDropper browser extension
title: Eye Dropper browser extension
description: A browser extension that lets you pick colors from anywhere on your screen. The source code is available on github. You can read more about the technical details in this article.

alt: thumbnail of the Yahtzee PWA sample app
title: Yahtzee PWA
description: A progressive web app sample to play Yahtzee. The source code is available on github.

alt: thumbnail of the my-track PWA sample app
title: My Tracks PWA
description: A progressive web app sample that lets you import and visualize GPS track files (*.gpx). Uses several PWA features such as Window Controls Overlay, File Handling, and Protocol Handling. The source code is available on github.

alt: thumbnail of the devtools highlighter addon
title: DevTools highlighter
description: A Firefox DevTools addon that lets you find elements that match arbitrary CSS style queries. Useful to list all position:absolute elements for example.

alt: thumbnail from the cheatsheet
title: CSS Alignment Cheatsheet
description:
Quickly visualize and remember the different alignment properties in various CSS layout types.
Read the full article about CSS alignment.

alt: thumbnail for the flexbox outline tool
title: Flexbox outline
description: Visualize the effect of justify-content, align-content and align-items in various flex directions and wrapping modes

alt: thumbnail for the baseline visualizer tool
title: Inline elements baseline visualizer
description: WIP of a baseline, text-top/bottom and line-height visualizer for inline elements (works mostly in Firefox Nightly)

alt: thumbnail for the filter editor tool
title: CSS Filter Editor
description: Concept for a CSS Filter editor user interface

alt: thumbnail for the in-between animation tool
title: In-between
description:
This is a tool that provides the in-between values as computed by a browser when animating CSS properties.
Just enter a property name and to and from values, and then drag the slider to see the interpolated values.

alt: thumbnail for the gradient overlay tool, showing a linear gradient with the tool on top of it
title: CSS linear-gradient overlay
description:
This is a visualizer tool for CSS linear-gradients.
You can also read my article about linear-gradients.

alt: thumbnail for the tool to create gradient by dragging on the screen
title: CSS gradient editor tool
description: Click and drag anywhere in the screen to create a linear-gradient background. Enter CSS color names/codes in the inputs to change the colors.

alt: Thumbnail for the sampler demo
title: Sampler
description: Assign sound URLs to the sampler buttons, and start remixing the web.

alt: Thumbnail for the animation timing function previewer tool
title: CSS timing function previewer
description: See how a given timing function influences a simple animation.

alt: Thumbnail for the box shadow editor tool
title: Box-shadow editor
description: Visualize how box-shadow applies to an element in css.

alt: Thumbnail screenshot of the css border-radius inspector tool
title: Border radius inspector
description: Understand how css border-radius works with this interactive demo that lets you control the horizontal and vertical radii of all 4 corners of a box.

alt: Thumbnail screenshot of the css transformer tool
title: CSS transformer
description:
This tool allows you to experiment with CSS transforms by entering any transform expression and visualizing the result of that transform on an element.
The tool shows both the un-transformed and transformed elements and let's you move and resize the element as well as the transform origin.

alt: thumbnail showing the css transform previewer tool
title: CSS transform previewer
description: Play with CSS transforms and see a live preview of the transformation.

alt: thumbnail showing a drawing done on a canvas using the littleengine lib
title: little engines
description:
Littleengines is a small canvas-based drawing library that let's you add engines that, once tied together, will produce spyrographic-like drawings.
You can check out this demo, and this one.
